summary.title: Scenario1
summary.description:
In the smart AVS, followed the architecture of a BMW Level-3 smart AVS, which allows for autonomous driving in
certain conditions. The driver can use a smartphone application to control the autonomous vehicle. The mobile
application shows various pieces of information about the vehicle, such as location, speed, and firmware updates
status. The vehicle contains different types of sensors, such as a camera, radar, and LiDAR, and actuators such
as ECUs that control it in autonomous driving mode by analyzing the outer environment. The vehicle is also able
to communicate with other vehicles using the vehicle-to-everything sensor or a GPS receiver. Based on the way
the different components work, we divide the whole use-case into three zones, i.e., sensor zone, cloud zone, and
consumer zone. To proceed with the use-case reconnaissance step, we first collected a detailed description of all
the stakeholders in the smart AVS use-case. Smart AVS is designed to automate the process of driving to reduce
the risk of accidents and make driving decisions intelligently.
